Articles.Content:
Something's been bugging me since I played 0.22 for some time; what is the point of sending multiple kerbals on a mission? If Jeb and Jeb alone can gather all the science by himself, it renders multiple-kerbaled missions pointless.

Since mental health reasons have already been suggested, I'm suggesting something along the line of kerbonaut specializations. I'm also thinking is that hiring kerbals with specific skills is not a one-mission deal, rather, you hire them for life, and you have the option of either using them on Kerbin or sending them to space.

-Scientist kerbals is needed on Kerbin for studying science probes and getting technology, but sending to space them will even yield more science that can't be obtained by probes.

-Engineer kerbals are used to assemble your rockets, and the better your engineers, the bigger and less expensive your rockets can be. You can also send engineers to space to do orbital assembly, or maintain and repair parts.

-Medic kerbals can prepare other kerbonauts' health before sending them to space, and you can also send a medic to space basically as a ship doctor, minimizing health issues and treating ailments.

Hiring kerbals isn't done with money, but rather, with reputation. In the beginning, you only get backyard kerbals eager to launch random things into space available to you, but as you do more achievement and gain reputation, you can hire better and better kerbal to suit your evergrowing space program.
